findings.issue: References ASCE/SEI 7 without specifying the edition year. For California K-12 projects under DSA, ASCE 7-22 as adopted by CBC 2022 is required for seismic design.
findings.existingText: Structural Performance: Hangers and supports for HVAC piping and equipment shall withstand the effects of gravity loads and stresses within limits and under conditions indicated according to ASCE/SEI 7.
findings.replacementText: Structural Performance: Hangers and supports for HVAC piping and equipment shall withstand the effects of gravity loads and stresses within limits and under conditions indicated according to ASCE 7-22 as adopted by CBC 2022.

findings.issue: Missing DSA-specific seismic certification and restraint requirements. DSA IR A-6 requires seismic certification documentation and compliance with OSHPD standards for seismic restraint of non-structural components.
findings.replacementText: Design seismic restraints in accordance with DSA Interpretation of Regulations (IR) A-6 and ASCE 7-22 Chapter 13. Submit seismic certification documentation per DSA requirements including OSHPD pre-approval (OPA) where applicable.

findings.issue: Missing DSA requirement for structural observation and special inspection of seismic restraints. DSA projects require special inspection per CBC Chapter 17.
findings.replacementText: Special Inspection: Provide special inspection of seismic restraints and hangers per CBC Chapter 17 and DSA requirements. Inspections shall be performed by a DSA-approved special inspector.

findings.issue: References ASTM C 533 without year designation. Current standard is ASTM C533-17, and the year should be specified for code compliance documentation.
findings.existingText: Insulation-Insert Material for Cold Piping: Water-repellent treated, ASTM C 533, Type I calcium silicate
findings.replacementText: Insulation-Insert Material for Cold Piping: Water-repellent treated, ASTM C533-17, Type I calcium silicate

findings.issue: References outdated ASTM A 36/A 36M. Current standard is ASTM A36/A36M-19. Year designation is important for material certification.
findings.existingText: Structural Steel: ASTM A 36/A 36M, carbon-steel plates, shapes, and bars
findings.replacementText: Structural Steel: ASTM A36/A36M-19, carbon-steel plates, shapes, and bars

findings.issue: References outdated ASTM C 1107. Current standard is ASTM C1107/C1107M-20. Year designation is important for material specifications.
findings.existingText: Grout: ASTM C 1107, factory-mixed and -packaged
findings.replacementText: Grout: ASTM C1107/C1107M-20, factory-mixed and -packaged

findings.section: Part 3, Article 3.2 - Hanger and Support Installation
findings.issue: References AWS D1.1/D1.1M without year. For DSA projects, the specific edition adopted by CBC 2022 must be cited for welding qualifications.
findings.existingText: Field fabricate from ASTM A 36/A 36M, carbon-steel shapes selected for loads being supported. Weld steel according to AWS D1.1/D1.1M.
findings.replacementText: Field fabricate from ASTM A36/A36M-19, carbon-steel shapes selected for loads being supported. Weld steel according to AWS D1.1/D1.1M:2020, Structural Welding Code - Steel.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: References ASHRAE 111 without year designation. The current standard is ASHRAE 111-2022, and the specific year should be cited for compliance verification.
findings.existingText: Instrumentation Type, Quantity, Accuracy, and Calibration: As described in ASHRAE 111, Section 5, "Instrumentation."
findings.replacementText: Instrumentation Type, Quantity, Accuracy, and Calibration: As described in ASHRAE 111-2022, Section 5, "Instrumentation."

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: References ASHRAE 62.1 and ASHRAE/IESNA 90.1 without year designations. California Title 24 requires compliance with specific editions of these standards.
findings.existingText: ASHRAE Compliance: Applicable requirements in ASHRAE 62.1, Section 7.2.2 - "Air Balancing."
findings.replacementText: ASHRAE Compliance: Applicable requirements in ASHRAE 62.1-2022, Section 7.2.2 - "Air Balancing" as adopted by California Title 24.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.section: Part 3, Article 3.4 - General Procedures for Testing and Balancing
findings.issue: References SMACNA's 'HVAC Systems - Testing, Adjusting, and Balancing' without edition year. The current edition should be specified.
findings.existingText: Perform testing and balancing procedures on each system according to the procedures contained in AABC's "National Standards for Total System Balance", ASHRAE 111, and SMACNA's "HVAC Systems - Testing, Adjusting, and Balancing"
findings.replacementText: Perform testing and balancing procedures on each system according to the procedures contained in AABC's "National Standards for Total System Balance" (current edition), ASHRAE 111-2022, and SMACNA's "HVAC Systems - Testing, Adjusting, and Balancing" (4th Edition, 2019)

findings.issue: References ASTM E 84 without year designation. The current standard is ASTM E84-23, and the year should be specified for fire performance testing verification.
findings.existingText: Surface-Burning Characteristics: For insulation and related materials, as determined by testing identical products according to ASTM E 84
findings.replacementText: Surface-Burning Characteristics: For insulation and related materials, as determined by testing identical products according to ASTM E84-23

findings.issue: References Section 078413 'Penetration Firestopping' but DSA projects require specific California fire-resistive joint system approvals and testing per CBC Chapter 7.
findings.existingText: Comply with requirements in Section 078413 "Penetration Firestopping"irestopping and fire-resistive joint sealers.
findings.replacementText: Comply with requirements in Section 078413 "Penetration Firestopping." All firestopping systems shall have California State Fire Marshal approval and be tested per ASTM E814 or UL 1479. Install per tested and approved assembly details.

findings.issue: References ASTM E 84 without year designation. Current standard is ASTM E84-23.
findings.existingText: Surface-Burning Characteristics: For insulation and related materials, as determined by testing identical products according to ASTM E 84
findings.replacementText: Surface-Burning Characteristics: For insulation and related materials, as determined by testing identical products according to ASTM E84-23

findings.fileName: 230553 - IDENTIFICATION FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT.docx
findings.issue: Brass valve tags may not provide adequate corrosion resistance for all K-12 environments, particularly in coastal California locations or where chemical exposure is possible.
findings.existingText: Tag Material: Brass, 0.032-inch minimum thickness
findings.replacementText: Tag Material: Stainless steel Type 304 or brass, 0.032-inch minimum thickness. Use stainless steel in corrosive environments.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: References Section 233113 'Metal Ducts' for duct leakage requirements but does not specify the leakage class required by California Title 24 for energy compliance.
findings.replacementText: Verify that duct systems meet the leakage class requirements of California Title 24, Part 6, typically Seal Class A (4 CFM/100 sq ft @ 1 in. wg) for supply ducts.

findings.section: Part 1, Article 1.3 - Action Submittals, LEED Submittals
findings.issue: LEED submittals reference LEED-NC, LEED-CI, and LEED-CS but K-12 projects in California typically pursue LEED for Schools. The requirements may not align with the appropriate rating system.
findings.existingText: "Product Data for Credit IEQ 4.1" Subparagraph below applies to LEED-NC, LEED-CI, and LEED-CS
findings.replacementText: Product Data for Credit IEQ 4: For adhesives and sealants, provide documentation per LEED v4 for Schools or applicable rating system being pursued for this K-12 project

findings.issue: References MIL-A-3316C which was last updated in October 1987. While still a valid standard, consideration should be given to more current industry standards or manufacturer specifications.
findings.existingText: Materials shall be compatible with insulation materials, jackets, and substrates and for bonding insulation to itself and to surfaces to be insulated unless otherwise indicated.
findings.replacementText: Materials shall be compatible with insulation materials, jackets, and substrates and for bonding insulation to itself and to surfaces to be insulated. Comply with MIL-A-3316C or manufacturer's recommendations for adhesive selection and application.

findings.section: Part 1, Article 1.3 - Action Submittals, LEED Submittals
findings.issue: LEED submittals reference LEED-NC, LEED-CI, and LEED-CS but should reference LEED for Schools for K-12 projects.
findings.existingText: "Product Data for Credit IEQ 4.1" Subparagraph below applies to LEED-NC, LEED-CI, and LEED-CS
findings.replacementText: Product Data for Credit IEQ 4: For adhesives and sealants, provide documentation per LEED v4 for Schools or applicable rating system being pursued for this K-12 project

findings.issue: References MIL-A-24179A which is an older military specification. Consider citing manufacturer recommendations as primary reference.
findings.existingText: Flexible Elastomeric and Polyolefin Adhesive: Comply with MIL-A-24179A, Type II, Class I.
findings.replacementText: Flexible Elastomeric and Polyolefin Adhesive: Comply with MIL-A-24179A, Type II, Class I, or manufacturer's recommended adhesive meeting equivalent performance requirements.

findings.issue: Inconsistent spacing format. 'MSS:' uses colon with no extra space before definition, while standard CSI format typically uses colon followed by two spaces.
findings.existingText: MSS:  Manufacturers Standardization Society
findings.replacementText: MSS:  Manufacturers Standardization Society

findings.issue: Misspelling: 'Touchup' should be 'Touch-Up' per standard industry terminology.
findings.existingText: Touchup: Clean field welds
findings.replacementText: Touch-Up: Clean field welds

findings.issue: References ASTM A 780 without year. Current standard is ASTM A780/A780M-19.
findings.existingText: Galvanized Surfaces: Clean welds, bolted connections, and abraded areas and apply galvanizing-repair paint to comply with ASTM A 780.
findings.replacementText: Galvanized Surfaces: Clean welds, bolted connections, and abraded areas and apply galvanizing-repair paint to comply with ASTM A780/A780M-19.

findings.fileName: 230553 - IDENTIFICATION FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT.docx
findings.issue: Lettering size requirement of '1-1/2 incheshigh' has no space before 'high'.
findings.existingText: Lettering Size: At least 1-1/2 incheshigh.
findings.replacementText: Lettering Size: At least 1-1/2 inches high.

findings.issue: Text contains apparent copy-paste error: 'Section 078413 "Penetration Firestopping"irestopping' has duplicate/malformed text.
findings.existingText: Comply with requirements in Section 078413 "Penetration Firestopping"irestopping and fire-resistive joint sealers.
findings.replacementText: Comply with requirements in Section 078413 "Penetration Firestopping" for firestopping and fire-resistive joint sealers.

findings.section: Part 3, Article 3.8 - General Pipe Insulation Installation
findings.issue: Inconsistent capitalization: 'Midwest Insulation Contractors Association's' should follow standard title case for organization names.
findings.existingText: See the Midwest Insulation Contractors Association's "National Commercial & Industrial Insulation Standards," Plate No. 41A.
findings.replacementText: See the Midwest Insulation Contractors Association's "National Commercial & Industrial Insulation Standards," Plate No. 41A.

findings.section: Part 3, Article 3.7 - Hanger and Support Schedule
findings.issue: The specification lists 38 different MSS hanger types with extensive subcategories. This level of prescription is excessive and restricts the contractor's means and methods. A performance-based approach referencing MSS SP-69 and SP-89 compliance would be more practical and allow for value engineering.
findings.existingText: Horizontal-Piping Hangers and Supports: Unless otherwise indicated and except as specified in piping system Sections, install the following types: [followed by 38 detailed MSS types]
findings.replacementText: Horizontal-Piping Hangers and Supports: Select hangers and supports in accordance with MSS SP-69 and MSS SP-89 appropriate for the pipe size, service, and load conditions. Hangers shall be of the adjustable type unless fixed hangers are specifically required.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: The specification requires plus or minus 10 percent tolerance for all air and water flow rates. For a K-12 school with tight budget constraints, 10% tolerance is achievable but requires significant time and cost. Industry standard ASHRAE 111 allows 10% for critical spaces but 15-20% for non-critical areas. This blanket requirement is unnecessarily restrictive for spaces like storage rooms or corridors.
findings.existingText:
Set HVAC system's air flow rates and water flow rates within the following tolerances:
Supply, Return, and Exhaust Fans and Equipment with Fans: Plus or minus 10 percent.
Air Outlets and Inlets: Plus or minus 10 percent.
findings.replacementText:
Set HVAC system's air flow rates and water flow rates within the following tolerances:
Supply, Return, and Exhaust Fans and Equipment with Fans: Plus or minus 10 percent.
Air Outlets and Inlets: Plus or minus 10 percent for occupied spaces; plus or minus 15 percent for non-critical spaces such as storage, mechanical, and electrical rooms.

findings.section: Part 3, Article 3.8 - Installation of Mineral-Fiber Insulation
findings.issue: Specification requires pins spaced at 16 inches o.c. and 3 inches from joints for duct insulation. While this provides secure attachment, it's overly conservative for horizontal rectangular ducts in non-seismic or low-seismic zones. Standard practice of 24 inches o.c. would be adequate for many applications and reduce installation time and material costs.
findings.existingText: On duct sides with dimensions larger than 18 inches, place pins 16 inches o.c. each way, and 3 inches maximum from insulation joints.
findings.replacementText: On duct sides with dimensions larger than 18 inches, place pins 24 inches o.c. each way for non-seismic or low-seismic applications, and 16 inches o.c. for seismic applications per SMACNA seismic restraint guidelines. Space 3 inches maximum from insulation joints.
